8/26/01
New Wacky Wednesday Event:
Come to our first ever scavenger race! Be there or be square. meet at 8:30pm (eastern) Wednesday night August 29th in West Freeport near the tents outside the gates. I will be giving you the race details at the time of the event. We will either be doing this in pairs or singularly (depending on turn out). There is an entrance fee of 1pp for the race. The monies will be given to the winner as well as a prize. This should be a lot of fun! See you all there!
By Arri Ghent
Scavenger Hunt!
.
As some of you know I have been thinking about bumping up my armor. Through some suggestions I decided to go with Ry'gorr. The stats were good, and it was something I thought I could afford. But, imagine my disappointment when it turned out looking just like ordinary banded armor!
What are you lookin' at?
By Kamdar Entil'Zha
8/04/01
I had heard that it only looks this way if you do not have the Velious expansion pack, so I figured, what the heck, I'm close enough to level 35 (Verant's recommendation for exploring Velious) so I went out and got the Scars of Velious expansion and installed it. And guess what? I still looked the same. I started to think that this was what it was supposed to look like on my race and class, but after doing a little more research, I discovered that I had to go into an Everquest congifurations file and edit it.
Specifically I had to open the EQclient file and change the Load Armor settings from "FALSE" to "TRUE" like this:
LoadArmor17=TRUE
LoadArmor18=TRUE
LoadArmor19=TRUE
LoadArmor20=TRUE
LoadArmor21=TRUE
LoadArmor22=TRUE
LoadArmor23=TRUE
Then I fired up EQ again... and drum roll please....
I looked like this. Quite a difference, huh? My main questions are which Kamdar will the rest of you folks be looking at? Even if you have the Velious expansion, will you have to go through the same hoops just to see the different armor? Shouldn't these "LoadArmor" settings be automatically set to "True"?
And finally, now that I have the Rygorr, I'm not sure what I think about the new look. Those little studs on my chest area look like the Batman movie suits! Also, I think it makes me look a little too busty! We all know that Chonn has gender confusion issues already! Maybe its a good thing it will look like banded to some of you! In any event, those Ivy Etched sleeves are gonna have to go. They clash with both versions!
A Woeful tale of Norrath Fashion
I really think your characters should look the same for everyone.
News Archives:
July
.
I also recently discovered that I should add a couple of lines that weren't in the file. They are:
LoadVeliousArmor=TRUE
LoadArmor24=TRUE

You will also learn that now the game takes longer on it's initial load time, with all the new textures

Raid in Runnyeye!
Our first guild raid is scheduled, and it should be a doozy!
It will take place on August 15th at 8:30pm (Eastern) at the Runnyeye Citidel. Please try to attend. And don't forget to visit EQ Atlas to print yourselves up some maps of what can be a very confusing zone!
Hopefully we'll get some phat loot and there won't be too many casualties!
In any event, it should be alot of fun!

8/12/01
Runnyeye info and maps
8/19/01
Attention Paladins and Shadow Knights!
During our raid in Runnyeye last Wednesday, I came across a nice item. This Sporali Defender's Blade has pretty good stats and is even listed on Allakhazam's Magical Realm as being worth 853pp, though I find their prices are often inflated. Still, it's a pretty good blade, but it can only be equipped by a Paladin or a Shadow Knight. The first Pally or SK that can contact me in Norrath with a Greater Lightstone to trade will get the blade.
I will instruct you where to go and who to make the trade with.
It will be in the Freeport area, so don't worry if I am in Velious, just send me a tell when you have the Lightstone.
By Kamdar Entil'Zha
